page.title: 06GROVE ROAD SCHOOL
page.content: The school was built in 1896 by the Harrogate School Board and later became the County Primary School replacing the Free Church School. There were 394 pupils present when the new school opened on August 31st 1897. The building is of stone, three stories high with staircases at each corner, and attics in the turret rooms above each staircase. Each floor has a central hall with six classrooms off. There is a large playground with a shelter for bad weather. The old Headteacher's House is now used as a Nursery and the Caretaker's as a Youth Club
